Experience The Agony of Defeat &
The Thrill of Victory!

Participate in an exciting tournament weekend in May 2025! Actual date/times TBD. WHCFC will host and organize a tournament of up to 10 teams in a park setting.

Catch the Fever of FIFA World Cup Football and commemorate this historical event as it comes to Toronto in 2026! WHCFC will engage communities, businesses as we promote football and fitness

Be part of the excitement of fun and friendly competition and community festivities. Email fcwhitehaven@gmail.com or call (416) 558-1330 for more info.

Why Join WHCFC?

‚öΩ

Free Football Experiences

Attend our Wednesday and Sunday scrimmages at no cost and no obligation. Participate in team play and summer tournaments with no cost.

üèÜ

Team Play and Tournaments

Enjoy competitive football opportunities without the financial burden. Join a team with minimal uniform costs and benefit from our efforts to keep expenses low.

üåü

Community and Networking

Interact with like-minded individuals, develop long-term relationships, and be part of a supportive community. Build connections that enhance both personal and professional growth.

üìö

Educational Workshops

Join free workshops focused on developing life skills, career growth, and personal development. Enhance your skills and knowledge to support your future endeavors.

Our Vision

WHCFC aims to be Scarborough‚Äôs first club offering free soccer opportunities, promoting community, diversity, and inclusivity. We strive to foster a welcoming environment for equity-deserving groups and celebrate cultural differences. Our goal is to enhance community spirit through football while providing free educational workshops on essential life skills like project management and mental health.

Our Mission

While some costs may apply for team play and tournaments, we are committed to minimizing these expenses. WHCFC seeks to support marginalized communities by securing funding from government and businesses, ensuring accessibility and minimal costs for participation.

Message from Joe

In this heartfelt message, Joe shares his story on how he founded WHCFC and how his passion drove him to build free and fun opportunities for football players in the community, especially those in economically disadvantaged and equity-deserving groups. Hear his vision to be the only Scarborough club to provide free football experiences and his mission to develop communities through the power of interaction, tournament festivals and educational opportunities.
